segments.text: I see the boy balancing precariously on that stool, stretching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His face is a portrait of concentration; he really wants those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but think this isn’t going to end well if someone doesn’t take a look.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: For a moment, I almost wish I could warn him, but would he even listen?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The little girl is just standing there, arm outstretched, totally absorbed in the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a sweetness to her anticipation that makes me smile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, there’s something so unnerving about how they’re stealing cookies right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're breaking some kind of rule, and yet they look so innocent in their excitement.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: All those dishes remain piled up, just waiting for her attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel frustrated for that woman, so absorbed in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR
